title: Ralf Little webchat â your questions answered on football, The Royle Family and Caroline Aherne | Stage | The Guardian
summary: two pints of lager and a packet of walkers prawn cocktail .
trump , schwarzenegger or lord sugar : who 's best on the apprentice ?
ricky had me make him cups of tea during the tea break .
i never met anyone like caroline aherne and i do n't think i will again .
flat litter is a good anagram of my name â but i ca n't top tall filter .

documents.title: and that 's all for today ¦
text: guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 1:08pm really sorry i 've got to go , a real shame because i 'm quite enjoying myself .
great questions and a lot of fun - thanks for taking the time .
eastofhampstead asks : did working with jim royle give you a head-start when monkey life came along ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 1:07pm you could say that - watching jim royle is like a study in anthropology .
so yes , doing the voiceover for monkey life came pretty naturally after that .
have to phrase this as a question or it 'll just look rude .
how hard did you laugh when jim said : finger , my arse ! ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 1:06pm about as hard as i laughed at every other thing jim said , whether i was supposed to or not .
me and craig cash giggled so much when we were n't supposed to , i 'm amazed we even made it into the show .
karl straw asks : did you consider the richard character in dead funny or were you always up for nick ?
and did the impressions come naturally or take practice ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 1:05pm no , i was always considered for nick .
apparently his innate anger and sense of insecurity seemed to put me in the right casting bracket - not sure why .
i 'm no impressionist , but then again neither was the character nick , so i had leeway .
it was a lot of youtube and a lot of practice , and then not too much worrying .
someone told me my max miller was a bit south african , but otherwise i got away with it .
thomas paterson asks : when you play football , is your right foot still just for standing on ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 1:03pm always has been , always will be .
sometimes i 'll have a swing , but it 's usually a swing and a miss .
goligarchy asks : you once played 5-a-side football at gol in cardiff .
did you enjoy it ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 1:02pm good memory !
that was a long time ago .
i did , especially because i won .
thecubangentlemen asks : loved the cafe marvellous , bittersweet triumph of a show , with a superb ensemble cast .
moving on , is there a single role you 'd give your eye teeth to play ?
dr who ?
hugh hefner ?
widow twanky ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 1:01pm well , i think bond is relatively unlikely at this stage .
i 'd have to go for widow twanky out of those three .
i 've always been interested in villains that are antiheroes - they look like they 're more interesting to play .
people in situations where they do immoral things for the `` right '' reasons .
best example : walter white in breaking bad .
now that looks like it was fun to make .

documents.title: trump , schwarzenegger or lord sugar : who 's best on the apprentice ?
text: djw300 asks : trump , schwarzenegger or sugar : who 's the best on the apprentice ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:59pm schwarzenegger .
campanologist asks : who would win in a fight between a baboon and a badger ?
( sorry if you 've answered this before . )
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:59pm a baboon would tear its head off .
quaere asks : did you enjoy playing at windsor and eton fc ?
and are you still in contact with the royle family cast ?
it must be sad without caroline aherne .
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:58pm yes i did , even though they gave a penalty against me on my debut , and it was never a penalty .
terrible refereeing .
i 've played for chertsey , edgware town , and windsor and eton which was the highest level - though i probably had the most fun at chertsey .
bubobubo asks : what 's your favourite owl ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:57pm barn owl .
they 're cute .
djw300 asks : what 's your highest break at snooker ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:57pm 21 .
seven yellows .

documents.title: ricky had me make him cups of tea during the tea break
text: eleanor mason asks : was it as fun filming royle family as it looked ?
assuming you all became a little family of your own .
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:56pm yes , yes it was !
it got to the point where ricky used to get me to make him his cups of tea during the tea breaks , and i had to remind him that i was n't really anthony ( still made them though , mind you ) .
comedyfan22 asks : if two pints was still being filmed , what do you think it would be like compare to what it was like in the earlier years ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:55pm it 's an interesting question .
i think we 'd all have kids of our own .
donna and gaz would have been through two divorces ; janet and johnny would be muddling along as always .
and louise would still be single and crackers .
1to618 asks : any chance we can see you on the bbc or c4 ?
i dont really rate itv and sky for comedy .
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:53pm really ?
the cafe , camping , hunderby , cold feet , stella ?
keep an eye out for borderline on channel 5 - series two starts filming soon !
they 're out there if you look for them .

documents.title: i never met anyone like caroline aherne and i do n't think i will again
text: ava asks : what was it like to work with caroline aherne ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:51pm a privilege every day .
she had a paradoxical blend of personality traits .
she could be cutting and generous at the same time .
mischievous and professional , shambolic and a perfectionist .
i have never met anyone like her before and i do n't think i will again .
bernie sanders 1888 asks : compared to the late 1990s and early 00s when the royle family aired how would you judge the state of british comedy and/or british sitcoms today ?
do you think there are a lack of quality programmes being commissioned , with an emphasis on cheap reality shows , etc ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:49pm there 's no quick answer to this .
i suppose , for my tastes , the royle family followed by the office was a golden age , but fashions evolve and tastes change .
we 've now seen a return to more traditional studio-based sitcom , which are as popular and critically praised as much as those earlier shows were .
so i just think these things probably go in cycles .
as for reality shows , not my taste , but people find funny what they find funny .
mylifeasanimposter asks : if you could drink only one beverage for the rest of your life , what would it be ?
you ca n't say tea .
tea does n't exist in this universe .
also , you ca n't add or subtract anything from your chosen beverage .
this is serious business .
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:47pm does water count ?
at least it keep me alive .

documents.title: flat litter is a good anagram of my name â but i ca n't top tall filter
text: id3334123 asks : do you have a favourite anagram of your name ?
tall filter is my current favourite closely followed by all flitter .
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:47pm up until this moment i 'd never thought of it .
flat litter is the best i can come up with - i do n't think i 'll ever top tall filter .
jonar asks : how do you like your bacon ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:45pm dead dead crispy .
humpty1873 says : i hated absolutely everything about two pints of lager and a packet of crisps .
what do you think about that ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:45pm that your opinion is as valid as anyone else 's .
id4317521 asks : do you resent that your career peaked so early with the royle family ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:44pm not at all .
what an amazing start to a career - it 's been going 18 years so far , so hopefully there 's plenty of time left .
25aubrey asks : i think your old pal ricky tomlinson has a laugh as manic as anyone who 's played the joker in film or television .
what do you think ?
and if he was recognised and got the part in a future film , would he take his aldi carrier bag on set with him and share the bitters with the riddler , penguin and catwoman ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:43pm i think that 's an absolutely fair observation , and if he did get cast , he 'd take his carrier bag bitters with him .
vammyp asks : i 've written an iain lee bio are you game for the lead ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:43pm i ca n't , i 'm already playing the lead in blake harrison 's .
gmonet : lurkio !
red sauce or brown sauce ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:42pm brown , any day of the week .
get that disgusting red stuff away from me .

documents.title: two pints of lager and a packet of walkers prawn cocktail
text: therealdonrobinho : two pints of lager and a packet of crisps what crisps would you choose ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:42pm walkers prawn cocktail .
unclearleo asks : i think i saw you once from behind walking down the road .
i was sure you were going to turn right at the next corner , but you carried on .
is this something they teach you in acting class ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:41pm drama school , term two , week three .
sparkius72 asks : will we be seeing you again soon ?
sheridan 's done well , but i 'd enjoy a bit more of our ralph .
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:41pm come to the national theatre !
ugly lies the bone .
press night tomorrow .
legal disclaimer : other theatres are available .

documents.title: john simm is very volatile ¦
text: andyb1967 asks : do you now refuse to have anything to do with john simm ?
playing the hooky part to its full extreme ¦ guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:40pm haha !
good question .
no , we 've not had a falling out .
but you never know with john , because he 's very volatile ( he 's not ) .
urbanpen asks : is there any chance you could give an working-class writer a break ?
i only ask because the bbc treat me like a fucking extra out of kes .
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:39pm sure , send it along to my production company , info @ littlerock and i 'll try and have a look .
johnny68 asks : i have a friend called philip smalley who is at 5ft6in .
with your name being little , i wondered how tall you are and does this sort of question annoy you a little bit .
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:37pm i 'm 6 feet tall , so pretty comfortable height-wise .
i always love a good pun , weak or otherwise .
thelasttree asks : the cafe was a brilliant , whimsical , romantic series !
do you think any more will be made ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:36pm i 'm afraid not - but thank you .
perhaps we should petition the government .
kbkc asks : if the royle family had continued , how would your character have fared ?
being upwardly mobile and male , would dramatic truth necessitate his near complete absence ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:36pm that 's actually a very interesting question and a fair point .
probably , yes .
in fact , i appeared less and less in later episodes for that exact reason - difficult to justify his presence there , any more .
mark o'connor asks : i remember you !
you were in that thing with the bloke in the seat with the nose and then that thing with the girl with the boobs in the flat .
can you afford to live now ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:35pm yeah , now i 'm in the thing with the guys at the national theatre .

documents.title: drinking a brew as we speak !
text: retentiveannals asks : 'ave yer put t'kettle on yet , lurcio ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:34pm drinking a brew as we speak !
pimpmasterflex asks : did you do death in paradise just for the free holiday ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:34pm it 's a very popular bbc1 show with great actors but yeah , the fact that it 's in the caribbean definitely featured .
montyburns56 asks : what 's your favourite splodgenessabounds track ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:32pm well , i only know one , and it begins : two pints
andrew newton asks : the cafe was a triumph .
have you been writing anything else , or any chance of a special of the aforementioned given the cliffhanger and the inevitable downbeat future for both protagonists ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:32pm thanks !
i think that 's probably the end of it , i 'm afraid .
i 'd like to think they would have found each other eventually .
sirdogsy asks : i saw you play in that celebrity football match thing and thought you were a great player .
what stopped you pursuing the full-time professional route ?
did acting get in the way ?
if so , any regrets ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:31pm i do n't know there 's always some story about could have , would have , etc , but i still get to do what i love doing so no complaints .
plus i got to play against zidane anyway .
arnoldd asks : what would anthony royle be doing these days ?
would jim still be leeching of his success ?

guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:30pm i 'd like to think he 's doing pretty well in middle management , drives a mid-range audi , and jim borrows more money than he ever has before .
ferrisfromflorida asks : do you leave things around ?
or are you neat ?
big fan of royal family .
have a giant poster of you , signed by you , hanging in my house above my jukebox and a single pine cone .
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:29pm yes i do leave things lying around - do you ?
jonathan chadwick asks : have you ever been to sealand ?
is it nicer than milton keynes ?
guardian contributor ralf little 28 february 2017 12:29pm i 'm ashamed to say i 've never been , even though i have four international caps .
one day i 'll visit the homeland .

documents.title: ralf is with us now
text: ralf is joining us live from the national theatre .
beaumont-thomas for the guardian

documents.title: post your questions for ralf little
text: permanently tracksuit-clad and put upon to make tea , ralf little first came to attention in the royle family , the sofa-bound sitcom about a brood of slightly dysfunctional mancunians .
alongside stage roles , he then appeared in six seasons of another hit sitcom , two pints of lager and a packet of crisps .
behind the scenes , he 's worked as a screenwriter , and co-founded the littlerock production company , which recently brought the customs comedy borderline to channel 5 and netflix .
he 's also a semi-pro footballer , having played for edgware town , chertsey town and sealand 's national team .
following a run in dead funny , he 's on stage again in the national theatre 's ugly lies the bone , a recent hit in new york for playwright lindsey ferrentino .
ahead of the play opening on 1 march , ralf joins us to answer your questions about anything in his career in a live webchat at 12.15pm gmt on tuesday 28 february post them in the comments below .

bulletin.text: The actor and producer joined us live from the National Theatre to weigh in everything from his most-coveted role to which packet of crisps goes best with two pints of lager.
